sentences.sentence: YOUR VIEW: Letters to the editor: our readers share their views.
Please send your letters toletters@independent.co.ukThe government's failure to increase ouroffshore windfarmslast month seemed a matter of incompetence.
Now that the government is supporting theRosebank oilfieldwith a £4 billion tax break, it seems more like a conspiracy.Thefuture of our childrendepends on reducing our use offossil fuels.
But that is where the governmentputs its money,even though renewables will clearly be a more rational investment.

What hold has Big Oil over our government?John BondOxfordHow low can you goI really didn't think the home secretary Suella Braverman couldget any “nastier”but her speech to theright-wing think tankin the US has proved me wrong.After her attempts to get positive headlines in the mediawith her Rwanda planand her barge scheme both went disastrously wrong, Braverman is now trying to starta leadership campaigndenigrating almost anyone with a valid reason to claim asylum and even went as far as to suggest that theUNHCR shouldwater down the 1951 refugee convention.David FeltonWistastonThe real world is closing in around TrumpSo, a judge in New York has heldDonald Trumpand his adult sons Donald Jr. and Ericliable for fraud by lyingabout the value of their properties for years.
AssessingTrump's plea of innocence, the judge said, "That is a fantasy world, not the real world.

"There is now a very real possibility that Trump will lose most of his financial empire, although we can expect appeals to every appellate court in New York, to the US Supreme Court, and probably to the Interplanetary Tribunal of Galactic Justice.This is the same man thathalf the country wants to installin the presidency to run the United States into the ground.

That's the real world.And Trump himself is still confident they will propel himinto the Oval Officenext year to add to the world's crises.Abraham Lincoln, a Republican worthy of the name, was right when he said, "You can fool some of the people all of the time and all of the people some of the time."
Those are pretty good odds.Mike BarrettVirginiaWe are closing the door on the civilised worldThe downside of leaving theEUis now clear to nearly everyone except the diehard zealots.

Now we hearDowning Streetreportedly supporting Suella Braverman, in threatening toleave the ECHR.On top of this many on the far right are calling for us to leave the World Economic Forum and the World Health Organisation too.
Having closed the door on our European friends, we are now on a route to close the door on the civilised world.

These organisations improve a lot for ordinary people across the globe.Unlesssanity returns, we shall have scarcely more friends thanNorth Koreaand nearly as little influence.Robert BostonKentThis government is pursuing power without responsibilityThe recent report that describes theterminal decline of many speciesin the UK comes as no surprise to those of us who have watched the catastrophic diminution of the nation's flora and fauna over the last 50 years.

There are40 million fewer birdsin the UK landscape than in the 1960s; this is not just a matter of regret but an indicator of future perils that will beset all forms of life, including the human species if concerted action isn't taken.Lack of care and adequate legislation has led to the ripping out of hedgerows and poisoning our earth, air, and water on which all forms of life depend.
Poor husbandry has been made worse, of course, by climate change.

Faced with this appalling ecocide, a government committed to deregulationand delaying action onclimate change massages the truth and tells us that legislation is in place to protect the natural world.The concerted efforts by many environmental groups toengage young peoplewith the natural world and mobilise them to take action in response to the terminal decline of many species is the only hope we have while those in government continue to ignore the evidence in their pursuit of power without responsibility - for allour children's future.Graham PowellCirencester

documents.result_message: Our detector is highly confident that the text is written entirely by a human.
documents.inputText: YOUR VIEW: Letters to the editor: our readers share their views. Please send your letters toletters@independent.co.ukThe government’s failure to increase ouroffshore windfarmslast month seemed a matter of incompetence. Now that the government is supporting theRosebank oilfieldwith a £4 billion tax break, it seems more like a conspiracy.Thefuture of our childrendepends on reducing our use offossil fuels.  But that is where the governmentputs its money,even though renewables will clearly be a more rational investment. What hold has Big Oil over our government?John BondOxfordHow low can you goI really didn’t think the home secretary Suella Braverman couldget any “nastier”but her speech to theright-wing think tankin the US has proved me wrong.After her attempts to get positive headlines in the mediawith her Rwanda planand her barge scheme both went disastrously wrong, Braverman is now trying to starta leadership campaigndenigrating almost anyone with a valid reason to claim asylum and even went as far as to suggest that theUNHCR shouldwater down the 1951 refugee convention.David FeltonWistastonThe real world is closing in around TrumpSo, a judge in New York has heldDonald Trumpand his adult sons Donald Jr. and Ericliable for fraud by lyingabout the value of their properties for years. AssessingTrump’s plea of innocence, the judge said, "That is a fantasy world, not the real world."There is now a very real possibility that Trump will lose most of his financial empire, although we can expect appeals to every appellate court in New York, to the US Supreme Court, and probably to the Interplanetary Tribunal of Galactic Justice.This is the same man thathalf the country wants to installin the presidency to run the United States into the ground. That’s not the "fantasy world." That’s the real world.And Trump himself is still confident they will propel himinto the Oval Officenext year to add to the world’s crises.Abraham Lincoln, a Republican worthy of the name, was right when he said, "You can fool some of the people all of the time and all of the people some of the time." Those are pretty good odds.Mike BarrettVirginiaWe are closing the door on the civilised worldThe downside of leaving theEUis now clear to nearly everyone except the diehard zealots. Now we hearDowning Streetreportedly supporting Suella Braverman, in threatening toleave the ECHR.On top of this many on the far right are calling for us to leave the World Economic Forum and the World Health Organisation too. Having closed the door on our European friends, we are now on a route to close the door on the civilised world. These organisations improve a lot for ordinary people across the globe.Unlesssanity returns, we shall have scarcely more friends thanNorth Koreaand nearly as little influence.Robert BostonKentThis government is pursuing power without responsibilityThe recent report that describes theterminal decline of many speciesin the UK comes as no surprise to those of us who have watched the catastrophic diminution of the nation’s flora and fauna over the last 50 years. There are40 million fewer birdsin the UK landscape than in the 1960s; this is not just a matter of regret but an indicator of future perils that will beset all forms of life, including the human species if concerted action isn’t taken.Lack of care and adequate legislation has led to the ripping out of hedgerows and poisoning our earth, air, and water on which all forms of life depend. Poor husbandry has been made worse, of course, by climate change. Faced with this appalling ecocide, a government committed to deregulationand delaying action onclimate change massages the truth and tells us that legislation is in place to protect the natural world.The concerted efforts by many environmental groups toengage young peoplewith the natural world and mobilise them to take action in response to the terminal decline of many species is the only hope we have while those in government continue to ignore the evidence in their pursuit of power without responsibility – for allour children’s future.Graham PowellCirencester
